intro: Fadogia djalonensis, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in savannah and woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and traditional contexts.
